definition[1]: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad
example[1]: accusations of institutional racism in the police force
example[2]: economic and monetary union and related institutional reform of the EU
definition[3]: relating to activities of financial institutions, rather than other organizations or members of the public
example[3]: Most of the investment was from institutional money.
example[4]: Dealers reported a fair degree of institutional buying of the shares.
